items.name: Chest
items.description: Similar to your inventory. Holds up to 27 stacks of items or blocks.

items.name: Crafting Table
items.description: When placed on the ground, it provides use of the 3×3 crafting grid.

items.name: Furnace
items.description: Provides the ability to smelt ores and cook food.

items.name: Sticks
items.description: Used as handles for tools and weapons as well as for ladders, signs, torches and fences.

items.name: Torches
items.description: Torches create light. They also have the ability to melt ice and snow.

items.name: Wood Planks
items.description: Can be used as a building material, but is usually used for a wide variety of crafting recipes.

items.name: Anvil
items.description: Used to combine enchantments and repair and rename items or blocks. Anvils are affected by gravity.

items.name: Beacon
items.description: Emits a light beam that can provide temporary player buffs, when placed on a pyramid made of diamond, emerald, gold or iron blocks. Can also be used as a landmark.

items.name: Block of Coal
items.description: The block of coal is a compact way to store coal, and can be used for decoration and fuel.

items.name: Block of Quartz
items.description: Blocks of Quartz are mineral blocks crafted from Nether Quartz that are used only for decoration.

items.name: Block of Redstone
items.description: Redstone blocks are compacted blocks can be used as a redstone power source.

items.name: Bookshelf
items.description: Used as decoration or to give an Enchantment Table, a boost for better enchantments.

items.name: Brick Block
items.description: Decorative building material.

items.name: Chiseled Quartz Block
items.description: Used as decorative building material.

items.name: Chiseled Sandstone
items.description: Chiseled Sandstone is a decorative form of sandstone with a Creeper face and various small carvings on it.

items.name: Clay Block
items.description: Clay blocks can be used as building material or to store clay.

items.name: Glowstone
items.description: Glowstones emits more light than a normal torch. It will melt nearby snow and ice. Breaking a glowstone block, will give 2-4 Glowstone Dust back.

items.name: Hay Bale
items.description: Used as decorative block, or as food for horses.

items.name: Jack-O-Lantern
items.description: Acts as a torch, but emits more light. Can stay lit underwater and melts nearby snow.

items.name: Nether Brick
items.description: Nether bricks are blocks found only in the The Nether. They are immune to Ghast fireballs.

items.name: Pillar Quartz Block
items.description: Used as decorative building material.

items.name: Sandstone
items.description: Used as a building material. Sandstone is not influenced by gravity like normal Sand.

items.name: Smooth Sandstone
items.description: Smooth Sandstone is a decorative form of sandstone with a smoother texture.

items.name: Snow Block
items.description: Used as building material, decoration and storing snowballs. Snow blocks are harder to be destroyed than normal snow and are impervious to torches and water.

items.name: Stained Clay
items.description: Stained hardened clay are colored variations of hardened clay. They are available in the same colors as dyed wool. Hardened Clay is a smelting recipe.

items.name: Stone Brick
items.description: Used as building material. There is various versions of stone bricks, eg. chiseled stone brick which can only be found in jungle temples.

items.name: Stone Slabs
items.ingredients: Stone, Sandstone, Cobblestone, Bricks, Stone Brick, Nether Brick or Block of Quartz
items.description: Used for making stairs. Two slabs placed on top of each other, will create a normal sized double slab block.

items.name: Stone Stairs
items.ingredients: Stone, Sandstone, Cobblestone, Bricks, Stone Brick, Nether Brick or Block of Quartz
items.description: Easily make staircases with stairs. They are a more compact alternative to slabs, allowing a greater elevation change in a shorter horizontal distance.

items.name: TNT
items.description: When activated, TNT creates an explosion that damages nearby block and creatures.

items.name: Wood Slabs
items.description: Used for making stairs. Two slabs placed on top of each other, will create a normal sized double slab block.

items.name: Wood Stairs
items.description: Easily make staircases with stairs. They are a more compact alternative to slabs, allowing a greater elevation change in a shorter horizontal distance.

items.name: Axes
items.ingredients: Sticks + Wood Planks or Cobblestone or Iron Ingots or Gold Ingots or Diamonds
items.description: Used to chop wood and pumpkins, faster than by hand.

items.name: Bucket
items.description: Used to carry water, lava or milk. Water and lava can be gathered from water or lava blocks, that are not running. Milk can be obtained by clicking on a cow with the bucket.

items.name: Carrot on a Stick
items.description: Used while riding pigs to control them. The direction the carrot dangles is the direction the pig will go. The pig will run faster if the player right clicks while holding the stick.

items.name: Clock
items.description: Clocks are items that display the current in-game time. It is done by displaying the sun and the moon\"s position, relative to the horizon.

items.name: Compass
items.description: The compass will always point to your original spawn point. Can\"t be used in The Nether or in The End.

items.name: Fishing Rod
items.description: Used to catch fish. You can also use them to grab movable objects and drag them towards yourself. Rods have 33 uses (durability).

items.name: Flint and Steel
items.description: Used to create fire. Can set blocks or creatures on fire.

items.name: Hoes
items.ingredients: Sticks + Wood Planks or Cobblestone or Iron Ingots or Gold Ingots or Diamonds
items.description: Used to till dirt and grass into farmland for crops. There is a chance that seeds will drop, when you till grass blocks.

items.name: Map
items.description: The Map is used to view explored terrain. While a map is being held in the player\"s hand, it will gradually be drawn as the player explores the world.

items.name: Pickaxes
items.ingredients: Sticks + Wood Planks or Cobblestone or Iron Ingots or Gold Ingots or Diamonds
items.description: Used to mine ore and blocks. Only Iron and Diamond Pickaxes can mine all ores and blocks. Diamond is the strongest pickaxe.

items.name: Shears
items.description: Tools used to obtain wool from sheeps, leaves from trees, Red Mushrooms from Mushrooms or to get string from cobwebs.

items.name: Shovels
items.ingredients: Sticks + Wood Planks or Cobblestone or Iron Ingots or Gold Ingots or Diamonds
items.description: Used to effectively dig sand, dirt, gravel, snow and clay. Required to dig snowballs.

items.name: Arrow
items.description: Arrows can be used as ammunition for a bow or dispenser. Deals damage to players and creatures when they hit.

items.name: Bow
items.description: Ranged weapon used to fire arrows. To use the bow you must have arrows in your inventory.

items.name: Swords
items.ingredients: Stick + Wood Planks or Cobblestone or Iron Ingots or Gold Ingots or Diamonds
items.description: Melee weapon used to damage mobs, other player or to block attacks.

items.name: Boots
items.ingredients: Leather or Gold Ingots or Iron Ingots or Fire or Diamonds
items.description: Foot armor that adds extra protection against attacks, falling, fire and drowning.

items.name: Chestplates
items.ingredients: Leather or Gold Ingots or Iron Ingots or Fire or Diamonds
items.description: Chest armor that adds extra protection against attacks, falling, fire and drowning.

items.name: Helmets
items.ingredients: Leather or Gold Ingots or Iron Ingots or Fire or Diamonds
items.description: Head armor that adds extra protection against attacks, falling, fire and drowning.

items.name: Leggins
items.ingredients: Leather or Gold Ingots or Iron Ingots or Fire or Diamonds
items.description: Leg armor that adds extra protection against attacks, falling, fire and drowning.

items.name: Activator Rail
items.description: Used to activate TNT Minecarts or Minecarts with Hoppers.

items.name: Boat
items.description: Vehicle that enables you to travel in water, faster than swimming.

items.name: Detector Rail
items.ingredients: Stone Pressure Plate + Iron Ingots + Redstone
items.description: Functions like a Pressure Plate, it sends a Redstone signal when powered. Can only be activated by a minecart.

items.name: Minecart
items.description: Rideable objects used for transporting players or mobs along minetracks.

items.name: Minecart with Chest
items.description: Used to transport goods and items along rails.

items.name: Minecart with Hopper
items.description: Minecart that moves items in and out of chests in the same way as a normal hopper.

items.name: Minecart with TNT
items.description: Minecart with TNT that explodes when triggered by a activator rail or when it is hit.

items.name: Powered Minecart
items.description: Minecarts with Furnace can be used to push other minecarts. You need fuel to power this minecart.

items.name: Powered Rail
items.description: Non solid block that is used to stop or increase momentum of moving minecarts. Powered Rails are powered by Redstone currents. Whether this comes from a Redstone Torch, a Lever, a Button, another circuit, or a Detector Rail does not matter.

items.name: Rails
items.description: Rails are minecart tracks where minecart vehicles can travel along.

items.name: Daylight Sensor
items.description: Sends out a redstone signal during sunlight. The signal strenght depends on the sunlight intensity.

items.name: Dispenser
items.description: Dispensers can store 9 stacks of items or blocks in a 3x3 grid. When powered by a Redstone charge, it ejects the items in random order. Snowballs, eggs, fireworks and arrows are fired out as projectiles.

items.name: Doors
items.description: Wooden Doors can be activated by right-clicking on them or by an electrical redstone signal. Iron Doors on the other hand, can only be activated by an electrical redstone signal.

items.name: Dropper
items.description: The dropper is a block that can be used to eject items, or push items into another container.

items.name: Hopper
items.description: Moves items in and out of chests, dispensers and other blocks that can hold items.

items.name: Jukebox
items.description: Used to play music discs. Right-click the jukebox with a music disc selected to play it.

items.name: Lever
items.description: Sends an electrical signal when switched to the 'on' position. Stays in its current state, unless it is clicked again.

items.name: Note Block
items.description: Plays a note when used or powered by redstone. Right click it to change the pitch of the note. A different instrument is played depending on the type of block it is placed on.

items.name: Piston
items.ingredients: Wood Planks + Cobblestone + Iron Ingot + Redstone
items.description: Pushes blocks or entities 1 space forward. Can also move players and mobs. Activated by redstone circuits.

items.name: Pressure Plates
items.description: Triggers an electrical charge, when a player or mob walks on it. Wood Pressure Plates are also activated when something is dropped on them.

items.name: Redstone Comparator
items.description: Function similar to redstone repeaters. However, instead of one signal, the comparator receives two signals.

items.name: Redstone Lamp
items.description: Emits a light when powered by redstone.

items.name: Redstone Repeater
items.description: Redstone Repeaters can extend the current of a redstone wire beyond the 15 block limit. It can also delay the incoming signal. The switch can be toggled by clicking it and has 4 settings from 0.1 to 0.4 seconds delay.

items.name: Redstone Torch
items.description: Sends a constant electric signal. Can also be used as a receiver/transmitter when connected to the side of a block. Emits a small amount of light.

items.name: Sticky Piston
items.description: Pushes and pulls blocks and objects 1 space. Pulls the block it is touching when retracted. Activated or controlled by redstone circuits.

items.name: Stone Button
items.description: Sends an electrical signal when pressed. The signal lasts for approximately one second.

items.name: Trapdoor
items.description: Functions as a horizontal door but are only 1x1 block in size. Can be activated by right-clicking it or with redstone.

items.name: Trapped Chest
items.description: Chest that sends out a signal when opened. Can be used to create traps.

items.name: Tripwire Hook
items.description: Used to create a tripwire that activates a redstone signal. You can hang a string across a pair of hooks, and the tripwire will be activated when someone runs across it.

items.name: Weighted Pressure Plates
items.description: Similar to a normal pressure plate, but can only be activated by items. The number of items determines the strength of the signal. Comes in two versions, a light (gold) and a heave (iron).

items.name: Wooden Button
items.description: Sends an electrical signal when pressed like the stone button. The signal lasts for approximately one second.

items.name: Bowl
items.description: Used to hold mushroom stew and to milk a Mooshroom cow.

items.name: Bread
items.description: Eat to restore hunger. Restores 2.5 hunger points.

items.name: Cake
items.description: Restores 1 hunger point per use for a total of 6 uses. Returns empty buckets when crafted. Must be placed to eat.

items.name: Cookie
items.description: Eat to restore hunger. Restores 1 hunger point.

items.name: Enchanted Golden Apple
items.description: Eat to restore hunger. Restores 2 hunger points and regenerate health for 30 seconds. It also gives resistance and fire resistance for 5 minutes.

items.name: Golden Apple
items.description: Eat to restore hunger. Restores 2 hunger points and regenerates health temporarily.

items.name: Golden Carrot
items.description: Eat to restore hunger. Restores 4 hunger points. Golden Carrot is also used in some brewing recipes.

items.name: Melon Seeds
items.description: Plantable on farmland. Will produce one Melon Block each harvest.

items.name: Mushroom Stew
items.description: Eat to restore hunger. Restores 3 hunger points. The bowl can reused.

items.name: Pumpkin Pie
items.description: Eat to restore hunger. Restores 4 hunger points. Recipe fits within the 2x2 crafting grid of the players inventory.

items.name: Pumpkin Seeds
items.description: Plantable on farmland. Will produce one Pumpkin each harvest.

items.name: Sugar
items.description: Used to craft Cake, Pumpkin pie and when brewing a Potion of Swiftness.

items.name: Bed
items.description: Used to change time from night to day. In SMP, all players in the Overworld must be in beds. Also changes the spawn point of the player, but compasses remains unaffected until you die and respawn.

items.name: Book
items.description: Used to create book and quills, bookshelfs or an enchantment table.

items.name: Book and Quill
items.description: Books that players can write in, read and edit.

items.name: Carpet
items.description: Carpets are thin like pressure plates and can be used as floor decoration. The color of the wool determines the carpet color.

items.name: Cobblestone Wall
items.description: Decorative block that acts in a similar way to fences.

items.name: Ender Chest
items.description: A placeable block used to store items. They function like normals chests, but their items can be accessed by any other ender chest in the world. If the ender chest is destroyed, none of its contents will be dropped and new ender chests can be created to access them.

items.name: Eye of Ender
items.description: Used to locate Strongholds, repair an End Portal bloc and craft Ender Chests. When thrown, they float towards the direction of a portal, which appear in strongholds. After a few seconds, it will drop with a chance of breaking.

items.name: Fence
items.description: Used as a barrier that players and mobs cannot jump over, with the exception of spiders and spider jockeys. It is 1Â½ blocks high for mobs and players, but only 1 to other blocks.

items.name: Fence Gate
items.description: Fence gates serves as a door for a row of fences. They can be opened both inward and outwards. They are opened by right-clicking or with a redstone signal.

items.name: Fire Charge
items.description: Fire Charges can be used as a instead of flint and steel. Left click on an open area and a fire will start. Can also be used as ammunition for dispensers, where they will shot out as a fireball.

items.name: Firework Rocket
items.description: Firework that can be launched into the sky and explore. Adding more gunpowder increases the duration of the rocket. Up to three gunpowder can be used. Multiple firework stars can also be used, in which case all will go off simultaneously when the rocket detonates. By limiting the amount of gunpowder to one, it is possible to use up to seven firework stars.

items.name: Firework Star
items.description: Used to create firework rockets. The dye determines the colour of the firework, and the extra ingredient determines a special effect. Extra ingredient can for example be diamonds, gold nuggets or a mob head.

items.name: Flower Pot
items.description: Used as decoratives. Allows flowers, mushrooms, saplings, cacti, ferns and dead bushes to be placed in it.

items.name: Glass Panes
items.description: Glass Panes is a block that, can be shaped in similar way to fences. Their placement behavior is similar to Redstone, Iron Bars, and Fences. They have the same texture as Glass. They cannot currently be placed horizontally.

items.name: Gold Ingot
items.description: Gold is used in several crafting recipes, e.g. tools and armors.

items.name: Iron Bars
items.description: Similar to fences. They are only counted as 1 block high, instead of 1.5 blocks.

items.name: Item Frame
items.description: Used as decoration. Blocks or items can be placed inside the frame by right clicking the frame with the item selected.

items.name: Ladder
items.description: Used for climbing walls. You can climb either horizontally or vertically. To climb safely, you can sneak while climbing (hold shift).

items.name: Lead
items.description: Leads or leashes, can be used to tie up non aggressive mobs. Can be tied to more than one unit at the same time.

items.name: Melon Block
items.description: Grown when farming by planting melon seed. Can not be eaten, but can be used to store melon slices.

items.name: Mineral Block
items.ingredients: Gold Ingots or Iron Ingost or Diamond Gems or Lapis Lazuli Dyes or Emeralds or Redstone or Coal
items.description: Turns minerals into a placeable block. Can be used for expensive building block or storage.

items.name: Minerals
items.ingredients: Iron Block or Gold Block or Diamond Block or Emerald Block or Block of Redstone or Lapis Lazuli Block.
items.description: Separates a block into individual gems, ingots or dyes.

items.name: Nether Brick Fence
items.description: Used as a barrier that players and mobs cannot jump over, with the exception of spiders and spider jockeys. It is 1.5 blocks high for mobs and players, but only 1 to other blocks. Nether Brick Fence cannot be set on fire like wood fence.

items.name: Painting
items.description: Images used as decoration. Paintings can only be placed on flat, vertical surfaces. An easy way to get a painting to fill up an area is to mark the bounds with any solid block and place it in the bottom left corner.

items.name: Paper
items.description: Used as crafting material to create maps, compass and books.

items.name: Sign
items.description: Can display a text. Text can be 4 lines, 15 characters per line. To change the text, destroy the sign and place it again. Placed in the ground or on walls.

items.name: Stained Glass
items.description: Stained Glass is the dyed version of regular glass that can be used for decoration purposes.

items.name: Blaze Powder
items.description: Can be combined with an Ender Pearl to make an Eye of Ender. Can also be used to craft Magma Cream, Fire charges and Potions of Strength.

items.name: Brewing Stand
items.description: Brewing stands are used for brewing all kinds potions.

items.name: Cauldron
items.description: Storage of water for water bottles. They can fill glass bottles to make water bottles. Holds enough water for three water bottles.

items.name: Enchantment Table
items.description: The enchantment table allows users to use experience levels to enchant weapons, armor, and tools.

items.name: Fermented Spider Eye
items.description: Used in Potions. All potions with Fermented Spider Eye in have negative effects. This ingredient is mostly used in splash potions.

items.name: Glass Bottle
items.description: Used for brewing potions. To create a water bottle, right click on a water source with an empty bottle.

items.name: Glistering Melon
items.description: Used in brewing to create health restoration potions.

items.name: Gold Nugget
items.description: Used to craft Glistering Melon. Dropped by Zombie Pigman. Can be crafted into Gold Ingots.

items.name: Magma Cream
items.description: Used in Potions, mostly for fire resistance.

items.name: Bone Meal
items.description: Bone Meal or white dye, is used to color wool or sheeps light white.

items.name: Cyan Dye
items.description: Used to color wool or sheeps cyan.

items.name: Dandelion Yellow Dye
items.description: Used to color wool or sheeps yellow.

items.name: Gray Dye
items.description: Used to color wool or sheep"s gray.

items.name: Light Blue Dye
items.description: Used to color wool or sheeps light blue.

items.name: Light Gray Dye
items.ingredients: Ink Sack + Bone Meal or Gray Dye + Bone Meal
items.description: Used to dye wool light gray. Can be made using an ink sac and two bonemeal or gray dye and bonemeal. Combining gray dye with bonemeal is better because you make 4 light gray dye from every ink sac (instead of 3).

items.name: Lime Dye
items.description: Used to color wool or sheeps green.

items.name: Magenta Dye
items.description: Used to color wool or sheeps magenta.

items.name: Orange Dye
items.ingredients: Rose Red Dye + Dandelion Yellow Dye
items.description: Used to color wool or sheeps orange.

items.name: Pink Dye
items.description: Used to color wool or sheeps pink.

items.name: Purple Dye
items.description: Used to color wool or sheeps purple.

items.name: Rose Red Dye
items.description: Used to color wool or sheeps red.

items.name: Black Wool
items.description: Used as decoration or building material.

items.name: Blue Wool
items.description: Used as decoration or building material.

items.name: Brown Wool
items.description: Used as decoration or building material.

items.name: Cyan Wool
items.description: Used as decoration or building material.

items.name: Gray Wool
items.description: Used as decoration or building material.

items.name: Green Wool
items.description: Used as decoration or building material.

items.name: Light Blue Wool
items.description: Used as decoration or building material.

items.name: Light Gray Wool
items.description: Used as decoration or building material.

items.name: Lime Wool
items.description: Used as decoration or building material.

items.name: Magenta Wool
items.description: Used as decoration or building material.

items.name: Orange Wool
items.description: Used as decoration or building material.

items.name: Pink Wool
items.description: Used as decoration or building material.

items.name: Purple Wool
items.description: Used as decoration or building material.

items.name: Red Wool
items.description: Used as decoration or building material.

items.name: Wool
items.description: Used as a building material and can be colored with dyes. This recipe is not efficient because Wool can be easily obtained from Sheep.

items.name: Yellow Wool
items.description: Used as decoration or building material.
